page.title: 15HILL TOP TANK
page.content: in 1896, he secured Â£7700 in compensation and the tank and a pipe line and another tank in the works. 3000000 gallons of free drinking water are delivered to the works every day(though they usually take less) under the agreeement. The tank is 4 metres deep and recieves water by a series of pumps from Langsett Res. The tank is used as a header tank for the works. The water is used in the{Steel {Making Process} for steam raising etc. At the moment there are 500000 gallons of water in the tank. The tank is emptied once a year to clean out the electronic measuring device that sends down the water and the tank is visited once a year by an engineer.
